      Instead of using the Firewall's routing decision Match, which might be as general as "in_port" and inadvertently Match packets erroneously, construct a more specific Match based on the deserialized OFPacketIn's payload, which has been placed in the FloodlightContext already by the Controller.

      • convertRoutingDecisionDescriptors

        protected java.util.Collection<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.Masked<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.U64>> convertRoutingDecisionDescriptors(java.lang.Iterable<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.Masked<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.U64>> maskedDescriptors)
        Converts a sequence of masked IRoutingDecision descriptors into masked Forwarding cookies. This generates a list of masked cookies that can then be matched in flow-mod messages.
        Parameters:
        maskedDescriptors - A sequence of masked cookies describing IRoutingDecision descriptors
        Returns:
        A collection of masked cookies suitable for flow-mod operations

        protected void deleteFlowsByDescriptor(java.lang.Iterable<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.Masked<org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.U64>> descriptors)
        On all active switches, deletes all flows matching the IRoutingDecision descriptors provided as arguments.
        Parameters:
        descriptors - The descriptors and masks describing which flows to delete.

      • createMatchFromPacket

        protected org.projectfloodlight.openflow.protocol.match.Match createMatchFromPacket(IOFSwitch sw,
                                                                                    org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.OFPort inPort,
                                                                                    org.projectfloodlight.openflow.protocol.OFPacketIn pi,
                                                                                    FloodlightContext cntx)
        Instead of using the Firewall's routing decision Match, which might be as general as "in_port" and inadvertently Match packets erroneously, construct a more specific Match based on the deserialized OFPacketIn's payload, which has been placed in the FloodlightContext already by the Controller.
        Parameters:
        sw, - the switch on which the packet was received
        inPort, - the ingress switch port on which the packet was received
        cntx, - the current context which contains the deserialized packet
        Returns:
        a composed Match object based on the provided information

      • doFlood

        protected void doFlood(IOFSwitch sw,
                       org.projectfloodlight.openflow.protocol.OFPacketIn pi,
                       IRoutingDecision decision,
                       FloodlightContext cntx)
        Creates a OFPacketOut with the OFPacketIn data that is flooded on all ports unless the port is blocked, in which case the packet will be dropped.
        Parameters:
        sw - The switch that receives the OFPacketIn
        pi - The OFPacketIn that came to the switch
        decision - The decision that caused flooding, or null
        cntx - The FloodlightContext associated with this OFPacketIn

      • switchPortChanged

        public void switchPortChanged(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.DatapathId switchId,
                              org.projectfloodlight.openflow.protocol.OFPortDesc port,
                              PortChangeType type)
        Description copied from interface: IOFSwitchListener
        Fired when a port on a known switch changes. A user of this notification needs to take care if the port and type information is used directly and if the collection of ports has been queried as well. This notification will only be dispatched after the the port changes have been committed to the IOFSwitch instance. However, if a user has previously called IOFSwitch.getPorts() or related method a subsequent update might already be present in the information returned by getPorts.
        Specified by:
        switchPortChanged in interface IOFSwitchListener
